headline: Tater Tot Taco Casserole
description: A Mexican-inspired Tater Tot casserole recipe that is a fun and tasty twist on taco night, mixed with a favorite side of tots and baked all together.

video.description: A very big hit as an easy and fast delicious dinner for many!
video.name: Tater Tot Taco Casserole

name: Tater Tot Taco Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) bag frozen whole-kernel corn with red and green bell peppers
1 (12 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 (12 ounce) bag shredded Mexican cheese blend
1 (16 ounce) package frozen bite-sized potato nuggets (such as Tater Tots®)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Prepare a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.

Cook ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until completely browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Add in frozen corn, black beans, onion, garlic, and taco seasoning mix to ground beef; cook and stir another 10 minutes. Set aside to cool slightly.
Combine ground beef mixture in a large bowl with about 3/4 of the Mexican cheese blend and the potato nuggets; stir to combine.

Pour about 1/3 of the enchilada sauce into the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Add the tater tot mixture to the baking dish; lightly pat the mixture down into a solid, even layer. Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the potatoes.
Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Sprinkle remaining cheese over the casserole and return to the oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 5 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: My husband and I loved it just the way it was. I was out of regular enchilada sauce, but I used a can of verde sauce and it tasted great! It was a 28 oz can so I took the liberty of adding a little more than required so it wouldn’t dry out. It probably would’ve been fine.
I added 2 cloves garlic to the casserole mixture

This was easy to make and pretty tasty. I didn’t have enough tater tots, so used potato pom poms instead - I think the tater tots would have been better as they would have provided more texture. Didn’t rate 5 stars as I felt it was lacking something - didn’t seem hearty enough as a meal. I think it has good potential though, and I might try it as a filling for burritos with salad.

Whole family loves it, Kids and Grands and everything in between. Occasionally will add a pound of sliced mushrooms when browning onions and garlic to a stretch it even farther when extra kids are visiting.
Mexican was nice twist and it was good.. but I think I like the original better.. (personal preference)
Absolutely delicious! My stepson and i absolutely love this recipe. We make it often enough and it's perfect just as it is. YUM!
AOK...NO CHANGES !!!!

It was a hit. Mine was meat heavy (hubby likes meat), and probably tater tot heavy too. I didn’t have the size called for, so I estimated. I liked the green chili idea, but didn’t have any so I used a can of diced tomatoes with chilis. I used less cheese (hubby again), but it was tasty. I ate leftovers with sour cream and enjoyed it even days later.
Used canned corn and topped when done sour cream, olives ,green onions and avocado. was delicious.
I was a little skeptical but this recipe was great!! I followed it pretty close and we all loved it! It made enough for lots of leftovers after we 4 ate.
This was surprisingly very good. The only thing I changed, I added a can of tomatoes with chiles. My husband says its a keeper.
I'm sorry, this was gross. I followed the recipe exactly other than adding green onions at the end and placing the tots on top as reviewers have suggested. The flavors just didn't work.
Amazing! Everyone loved it. Served with traditional taco toppings on the side and it was a huge hit.
Next time I’ll add chili peppers to recipe but it’s not really needed.
So great !!

I feel like I made this once long ago and didn’t care for but I have tried it again about 8 months ago and then few times since and we love including this into our quick, weeknight rotation. I made exactly as is. We really like this one.! I use homemade taco seasoning from this site. And we love to add toppings like sour cream, fresh avocado, black olives, green onions, etc. great recipe!!
I couldn't find frozen Mexican corn so I used canned corn. Simple and delicious.
I made this for a church potluck, doubled ingredients except I substituted half the cheese for vegan/non-dairy kind to accommodate some lactose and dairy-allergy folks. Both pans were devoured!

This was very good. However the package sizes listed in the recipe were not to be found at my grocery store they were much larger so I had to adjust my overall ingredients to match package sizes available. Also served with sour cream on the side
I liked it, for me it needs salt, may not be the same for everybody. The recipe needs to be updated as 12 oz cans are outdated. Will definitely make again, overall a good recipe.

My boyfriend and I liked this. I sautéed half an onion and a bunch of cloves of garlic as well as half a bell pepper that needed to be used up. ( I didn’t tell him that . It’s hard to get that guy to eat veggies.) I added it to the meat mixture. Then I split a some of the tots and threw them into the mixture as well. I put most of the tots on top with cheese under them and over them as well as some black olives. It’s nothing special but it’s good, filling comfort food. Works well as leftovers/ take to work for lunch kinda thing and like I said you can hide veggies in it if you have picky eaters!
it was just okay. won't go back for leftovers, but one dish was fine.
Delicious! I used 2 lbs lean ground beef and added another can of enchilada sauce. Other than that. Great recipe

As others said I put meat mixture in bottom and topped with tots then covered them with remaining enchilada sauce. PERFECT! I also added a can of Rigel to meat mixture. Whata great recipe! Will become part of our dinner rotation!
not gonna lie...very disappointing. my three teenage boys didn't even eat the leftovers.
This was amazingly simple, and tasted outstanding. The only thing i did different was to put tater tots in rows to cover the top. They came out crispy and delicious!
So good and easy!!
We really liked this dish!!
Very good and easy! I used half the beans and cheese since family members don’t like them, and only mixed cheese in (so not putting on top). Perfect!
So good, I added corn to mine and it was amazing!!!

It was excellent! I substituted beef for ground chicken. Thanks for the recipe. I want to make this for the kids in the daycare that I cook at. Can you share the recipe for 100 kids? For some reason I can't change the qty on All Recipes.
Tastes great. Very easy to make.
My husband and young teen have requested this one for the monthly rotation. A recipe that’s delish just the way it is.
The ingredients seemed weird but this is our new favorite!!!
I made this tonight for dinner. The family loved it. We topped it with salsa and sour cream.
This recipe is so easy. Perfect meal when you want something to put together quick. I will have to make this again when the grandkids are over. I’m sure they will love it!
So easy to make, and very tasty!

I had slightly less enchilada sauce than required but it was fine. Also the frozen corn I bought also had jalapeno pieces and it really gave this some more flavour! The final modification I made was that I lined the bottom of the pan with the tater tots, put down the taco mixture as the middle layer, and then another layer of tater tots on top, and of course some extra cheese sprinkled on for the last 5 minutes of baking... It was so delicious!
This is very easy and tastes great! I added some green onions with the cheese at the very end. My toddler and husband really enjoyed it too.

I absolutely had to make an account to leave a review! This recipe is so delicious and so flavorful! The enchilada sauce gives it the right moisture it needs, and an amazing flavor as well! I love how it can go a long way too - I had some for dinner and then threw it in a tortilla the next day for an amazing breakfast burrito! This is definitely going in my staples!

Didn't find any enchilada sauce in stores near me so made my own from a recipe on this site. Though this isn't something i would normally make, COVID has all my young adults back home and they all loved this. I will just use more enchilada sauce next time to ensure everything is coated at least a little bit.

Fun find while I was looking for something different to do with ground beef tacos! Made exactly as written and had extras to top: scallions, jalepeño, avocado and sour cream. Could have used double the seasoning IMO and I'd sub or leave out corn next time.
Made just as described and it turned out great. Served with salsa, sour cream and jalapeños.
This was just okay, and will not be made again. Very simple to make and common ingredients. Made as instructed, no modifications or deviations. It just wasn't good.

Winner!! I did not add the beans but kept the remainder of the recipes the same. I opted to build this like one of the most helpful reviews shared. 
I used an oven proof skillet to cook the beef, onion, corn, spice mixture and added 1/3 of the sauce. Then I’m sprinkled half of the cheese on top of that, followed by the tots. Drizzled the remaining sauce and cheese. Then baked for 30 minutes. The tots come out crisp and the bottom is cheesy and delicious. Served with sour cream and picked jalapeños. Great Party dish.
Very Good!. I add jalapeno peppers because I like spice food!
Super delicious meal and freezes really well to have for meals later.
this is the first recipe I made with the dinner spinner app. got to say, I impressed my very picky girlfriend. lol. amazing recipe, easy and taste wonderful.

This was really good! I made a vegetarian version with ground impossible burger. I added a can of chili peppers and topped with cilantro at the end because I happened to have it. I thought it was a little spicy and next time will use 1/2 can of the chili peppers. Note....If you mix the tater tots will the meat as I did, the tots get absorbed into the casserole (which my family thought was good). If you put them on top to become crisp, they will taste more like tater tots. It all depends on your preference. I will be making this again.
Delicious! I wanted a little more moisture so I added diced tomatoes. Yum!
I have made this three times now and my husband absolutely loves it.
Everyone in my family loved it. Easy to make and delicious. Will definitely make it again.
Used turkey instead, okay flavor but not great

This was very good! I did not add the onion and used a little dried minced onion as the beef was cooking instead as I don't care for a lot of onion. I also saw from the reviews that some people thought the tots got soggy and/or lost in the mix so I tossed some into the beef mixture but then layered the rest on top. That gave the tots the nice crispiness I think a lot of people were missing. This is something I'll add to my stock of "things that should reheat well so I can make a batch and eat it for work lunches for a few days" repertoire.
I followed this to a T and it came out perfect! Very flavorful. Didn’t have to add salt once to it. The enchilada sauce takes care of that. My 3 yr old is loving it! Very rich flavor!

This is phenomenal!!! Even my children loved it. It is fairly easy to make and was a huge hit. We have 3 little ones and 2 adults in our house and this didn't make it past lunch the day after. Awesome.

I wanted to love this. Two family members liked it. I barely finished my serving. If I were to make it again, I’d double the tater tots and possibly the cheese as well. I’d also omit the taco seasoning and use plain cumin and chili powder to eliminate much of the salt. The only change I had made was to add a can of green chilies as so many suggested. I doubt I will give this another try though.
Everyone in our family loved this. Followed recipe as written. Not too spicy for kids. My 5 year old even asked for the recipe so he can make it when he grows up. Will make again for sure.

I made this for myself and 2 teenage boys, ages 14 & 17. My oldest LOVED it! My youngest said he would eat it without the black beans:) 
I made recipe as is and the only think I would change next time around(making it again for sure) would be to layer the tater tots on top of the meat mixture. It will allow them to keep their shape and maybe get a crispy coating. 
Mixed in with beef mixture, they fall apart. 
Overall, great recipe, Thank You!
This dish turned out very good. Was better the second day. Next time I will add fresh tamales with it.
Super good. Next time I would make it with green enchilada sauce.

The taco seasoning with the enchilada sauce made too much red chili flavor, overpowering and not great. We added diced green chillis, which was good, and precooked the tots and baked with them only on top. I don't think you can overcook the tots in this dish. I would not do it as recommended. I think for this dish to have a better chance of success, I I would add sour cream to counter the chili, and absolutely cut some or all of the taco seasoning.
This is a fantastic recipe! I made it for a casual party and even the picky eaters thought this was great. Super easy to put together as well.
It was awesome. I put the cheese on top before I baked it. Loved it. Baked it for 45 minutes and then I turned on the broiler and kept in the oven for an extra five minutes. My mom loved it
I meant to take a picture but my family dug in so fast I didn’t get a chance. It is so good!!!
It was okay. Nice change of pace but I don't think I'll be fixing it again.

This recipe is super easy for newer cooks. My girlfriend and I dont cook often and we tried this and it was fantastic. We used a 4 blend cheese and a can and a half of southwest corn which added a perfect amount of heat. I would recommend this recipe to everyone I know.
Great!
I didn’t use Tater Tots but put layers of tortilla corn shells ate the button and top of dish
Yummy

This was sooo delicious, I did read the reviews and added a can of diced green chili's. But other than that I followed the directions and it came out sooo good. This is something I will be adding to my rotated dinner recipes!! Everyone loved it!!
I just made this tonight for dinner and it turned out fantastic! Topped it with some sour cream and I will definitely make this again

Mine is in the oven as I write my review. I accidentally put the cheese on it before putting it in the oven. And I didn’t have the right amount of enchiladas sauce so I used two 10 ounce cans. I couldn’t find any of the frozen Mexican style corn at Walmart or Kroger so I put celery in mine. ????? I wished I’d grabbed a green pepper while at Walmart too but didn’t think about it. Didn’t have it on my list.
Delicious casserole!! I added some garlic salt and pepper to give it better flavor. I topped it off with sour cream and salsa. It was so good my BF loved it. I'll be making it again

This was real good. I thought the taco seasoning was too much salt, but it was actually ok. The beans and meat soaked it all up. I omitted the corn. My son doesn’t like corn. I mixed it all up in my baking pan and topped it off with the Mexican cheese blend. I topped the mixture with a little extra enchilada sauce. I’m glad I did or I think it would have been on the dry side. Thanks for the recipe.
With a few personal touches, it was awesome! Imperative to put the tater tots on top to keep them from getting soggy.

I didn’t use the enchilada sauce. Instead, I mixed 1 container sour cream with the taco seasoning & mixed it into the frozen tater tots. I also added about half of a chopped green bell pepper. SO GOOD!! The taco seasoning really sets off the flavor. YUM!

This was SO good. I didn’t have any Mexican frozen corn so I used a can of drained rotel and drained sweet corn instead. Delicious made it for my husband to freeze in portions so he can have lunches to take to work.
I found the recipe as listed and it was delicious. Will make again.
Delicious! Absolutely fatty and the junk food I needed after my diet. I dabbed sriracha on after and it was perfect.

Guess I'm a little late to the party! Amazing recipe and thanks to all the cooks before me, I made some 'tweeks' that I believe made this extra delicious. 

Following breakfast tater tot recipes to keep the tater tots crispy, I baked the tater tots for 10 minutes while browning the meat. I too added a can of mild diced chills and used my own taco seasoning mix to control the sodium. Onions and diced red peppers were sautéed with the meat to create additional flavor. And, just like a lasagna, I layered: Enchilada sauce (Hatch's green enchilada sauce), meat mixture, cheese and then the tater tots. I topped the tots with the remaining enchilada sauce and cheese. Family really enjoyed this comfort casserole! Thanks for the recipe.

COVID-19 5/10/2020 - I didn’t think we would like this recipe, but we did! I made this recipe almost as written since I had most of the ingredients on hand. Yes, I made some changes, but we’re in a Pandemic people and ya just gotta do what ya gotta do. I had frozen corn and diced up a red bell pepper, half of a jalapeño, and a little extra onion to try and add the flavors of a Mexican or Southwestern Style Corn. I grated cheddar cheese as I had a block of cheese and not a Mexican blend. My can of enchilada sauce was 15oz whereas the recipe calls for 12oz. I froze the remaining 3oz enchilada sauce. Your enchilada sauce used will make or break this dish, imho. So, make sure you’re using a sauce you like or doctor up whatever you’re using first to make your own enchilada sauce as Gina did. We loved the flavors of this easy casserole that yields plenty of leftovers, especially if you pair it up with a salad for a side. I felt the casserole could have used some extra sauce or tomatoes, but my husband thought it was fine. The tater tots are on the soft side with some crunch on top, but during reheating in microwave they get softer as expected, but nothing that deterred us from eating leftovers. Next time, I would not put enchilada sauce on top of the tater tots. To make it easier, I’ll use my cast iron to cook the meat and veggies, stir in the enchilada sauce, maybe add in some petite diced tomatoes or Rotel (unless using a medium/spicy enchilada sauce), place a layer of tater tot
Nothing to write home about. I used the crock pot method as one reviewer suggested. Tater tots were mush. If I make it again and that’s a BIG if, I’ll try the oven method.

It was delicious!!! I made a few modifications due to ingredients I had/didn’t have. I added a rotell can with green chilis into the meat mixture & I used the green enchilada sauce vs the red. I also used a lot more cheese. It came out wonderful! I didn’t need to add sour cream in the end because it was so flavorful and creamy. Will definitely make it again.
My husband and I loved it. I will definitely be making this recipe again.
My family loved this recipe. I will definitely make it again.
Family loved it!!! I think it needs something, but not sure what.

I found this recipe in the quarantine section. I was trying to find something to make for a friend and her family. My friend tested positive for Coronavirus and was recovering. I have made tater tot casserole before and could not wrap my mind around mixing the tater tots INTO the casserole. I followed others and added green chiles in and had to put the tater tots on top. I made one for our family and then one for the quarantined family. I sent along a container of sour cream since others had said they eat it with sour cream. I enjoyed this recipe. I can't say I like it better than the other tater tot casserole but I can say I have 2 recipes that I will be making in the future. My friend asked for the recipe!

Very tasty and fairly easy. Like a few others, I added 2 sliced green onions on the top to give it some green color and added taste. I also added a small can of chopped green chilies. 1lb of corn in my opinion was too much. Maybe next time I'll use perhaps 8oz of corn and ad some more beans.
add green chilies for a more unique taste. whole family loved it.
Interesting. Fun and versatile. Delicious!

If you make this according to the recipe, it won't look anything like the pictures, but we all know how that goes. I think the issue is with how the recipe suggests assembling this. I would recommend putting the tater tots in the baking dish and then pour the rest of the mixture over it. Combining everything before adding it to the dish and then pressing things down just creates a big pile of mush. Also, there's nothing green in the recipe, but the pictures appear to feature green onions. I'd definitely suggest adding those as a nice dash of color. And I'm not sure the enchilada sauce adds to this recipe all that much. I'd be interested in trying it without.
mediocre
Very good
I followed the recipe, but added rotel.
Used 1 pound of ground turkey, and a 12 ounce bag of yellow corn. Other than that, followed recipe and it was a hit with the entire family. Will definitely make again.
This was an amazing recipe! My whole family loved it.
This was not good at all, there is nothing to be done to help save this tater tot disaster. Threw it out & ordered pizza.
A friend shared that she made this casserole and her family loved it. My family loved it too! I make my own enchilada sauce to use with this.
